Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage was genuine or entered into primarily for immigration purposes
Evidence_Assessment: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of financial intermingling, unreliable documentary evidence
Decision_Outcome: IAD concluded marriage was not genuine
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate genuineness of marriage
Credibility_Factor: Credibility of couple's testimony and supporting documents
Legal_Rule: A marriage is not genuine if entered into primarily for immigration benefits
Procedural_Issue: IAD failed to raise specific concerns with applicant and excluded relevant evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Allegation of non-genuine marriage for immigration advantage
Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided on merits due to procedural fairness breach
Key_Evidence_Considered: Testimony inconsistencies, financial separation, documentary reliability
Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 72(1)
Applicant_Challenge: IAD's speculative conclusions and exclusion of evidence
Court_Result: IAD decision quashed, case remitted for reconsideration
Outcome: Decision set aside, matter returned for redetermination
Legal_Provision: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, subsection 72(1)
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Marriage not genuine, entered for immigration purposes
Applicable_Process: Sponsorship application, appeal to IAD, judicial review
Governing_Rule: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations regarding genuine relationships
